Line 1: Line 1:   +
{{sources}}
'''Dr R. K Kamboj''' ('''''Rajender K Kamboj, Rajender Kamboj, Raj Kamboj'''''), an eminent Indian [[Pharmaceutical]] [[scientist]] in the area of [[drug discovery]] was born in 1955. He did his M.Sc in Biological Sciences in 1977. He joined the [[University of Adelaide]], [[Australia]] in 1981 and completed his Ph.D in March 1986. During his doctoral studies at the University of Adelaide (1981-1986), Kamboj published his researches in ''[[Plant Physiology]]'', a highly cited peer-reviewed scientific monthly journal published by American Society of Plant Biologists, which publishes articles on the [[physiology]], [[biochemistry]], cellular and molecular [[biology]], [[genetics]], [[biophysics]] and environmental biology of plants. Kamboj's doctoral thesis was about ''Biochemical Studies on pollen and pollen-pistil interaction in `Petunia hybrida`''.
'''Dr R. K Kamboj''' ('''''Rajender K Kamboj, Rajender Kamboj, Raj Kamboj'''''), an eminent Indian [[Pharmaceutical]] [[scientist]] in the area of [[drug discovery]] was born in 1955. He did his M.Sc in Biological Sciences in 1977. He joined the [[University of Adelaide]], [[Australia]] in 1981 and completed his Ph.D in March 1986. During his doctoral studies at the University of Adelaide (1981-1986), Kamboj published his researches in ''[[Plant Physiology]]'', a highly cited peer-reviewed scientific monthly journal published by American Society of Plant Biologists, which publishes articles on the [[physiology]], [[biochemistry]], cellular and molecular [[biology]], [[genetics]], [[biophysics]] and environmental biology of plants. Kamboj's doctoral thesis was about ''Biochemical Studies on pollen and pollen-pistil interaction in `Petunia hybrida`''.
